page.title: 12WICKSTEED PARK KETTERING
page.content: Charles Wicksteed opened the park in 1920 for the Kettering people.Today it covers a vast area of 140 acres and employs 250 staff.Most of the local people visit quite often and people come from places like Yorkshire and London on day trips.About 1500 coaches and 1,150,000 people visit each year. Entrance and the car park are free and the free playground is the largest in Europe e.g.44 swings,15 slides,13 climbing frames,8 rounderbouts,2 see-saws, all made by Wicksteed Engineering Co. in Kettering.It also costs nothing to walk around the lake, try the nature trail or watch the peacocks.There is plenty of space for everyone to picnic or play their own games on the grass. A first aid station is always open in case of minor accidents.
